DIRECTOR
Executive Profile
A spirited and motivated leader able to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Able to mentor diverse, competitive managers into a mutually supportive team.
Long-standing record of creating marketing and communication plans, successful events, major website roll outs and upgrades, facility management and office supervision.

SKILLS

Communications, Editor, Event Planning, Special Events, Director, Fundraising, Graphics, Brochures, Catalogs, Marketing, Marketing Plans, Materials, Mentoring, Newsletters, Presentations, Processes, Public Relations, Recruitment, Strategic Plans, Supervision, Website, Annual Reports

06/2012 to Current
Company Name

Manages all the daily operations, public relations and marketing efforts of the KC Metro Center.
Responsible for developing marketing plan and materials to recruit students by working with the Director of Continuing Studies and the Marketing committee Manages the Kansas City Metro Center facility and supervises all clerical and part time positions Coordinates with faculty and departments that provide courses at the Center Works with local community colleges to create articulation agreements and plan other events Works independently to recruit students to attend the Metro Center by making contact with business and industry, working with area community colleges, school districts, chamber of commerce and other organizations Assisting other programs and departments to support recruitment and alumni efforts in the greater Kansas City area.

Manage 12 coordinators for the district's YouthFriends Mentoring Program.
Provided support to district's Educational Foundation by coordinating fundraising events and promoting student programs.
Complete yearly process to receive a grant from Kansas City for the Foundation.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Account Executive, Public Relations

Location: Illinois, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Public Relations

Description:
Role Summary:The Senior Account Executive that has a focus on media relations will independently lead $100-299K in retainer accounts or projects. The Senior Account Executive will manage multiple responsibilities including generating consistent media exposure for clients, supporting the development of key themes, campaign strategy, client relations and mentoring other members of the team. Financial experience in public relations is a must have for success in this role.
Responsibilities:Media Relations:Identifies and secures an array of media placements including high-profile and feature opportunities for clients across the teamDelegates tasks and helps with mentoring Account Coordinators, Account Executives, and interns Assists in the development of strategic PR plans and campaign development for team accounts they supportDevelops and maintains relationships with all media outlets including trades, broadcast, and national mediaDevelops unique story angles and timely pitches to generate consistent client exposureClient Service:Independently leads $100-299K in client account revenueServe as lead point of contact and run calls for the client accounts they are leadingDraft PR plans for the accounts they are leadingFunctions as a general point of contact (for clients and internally) for PR initiativesSupports the lead point of contact for other team client accountsParticipates in regular client update calls and meetings as well as new client discovery meetings for other team client accountsWriting:Reviews and edits company-generated content before sharing with clientsSupports in drafting press releases, award nominations, social media posts, and other client-related materials, when neededAdministrative Support:Assists internal team members with other clients, business development, and Company projectsReviews press reports before sending to clientsEnsures that the team has saved final versions to SharePoint and has scheduled press releases for distributionCompany Ambassador:Acts as a steward of the JConnelly brand, consistently representing and reflecting the Companyâ€™s core values, approach, and high standards of excellence in all client, media, and public interactions
Performs other duties as assigned
Education: College degree; or equivalent related business experience
Experience & Expertise:Minimum 3-5 years of successful industry-related experience with an emphasis on managing client relationshipsDemonstrated ability to organize/prioritize work, handle details accurately, follow up with minimum supervision, and complete tasks within specified deadlinesExcellent interpersonal, communication, problem-solving, and customer service skillsProficiency with various software applications including the full Office suite, as well as social media channelsProficiency in PR related software including but not limited to Cision, Meltwater, TrendKite, Sprout, Hootsuite, etc.Experience in financial aspects of public relations is required for this role.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
